page.title: 05 A Tourists View
page.content:
As you first come into Seaton from the main road you see a lovely view of the Axe Valley. When you walk to the town centre you can then walk down to the sea. You can also walk to the harbour and follow the river Axe to Colyford. You can also go across the oldest concrete bridge in England.
Seaton is a pleasant town with attractions like the Tramway, sea, golfcourse, bowls, tennis, cricket, football pitches, playing grounds, fishing trips, windsurfing and all the pubs, restaurants, shops and gardens.
There is a lot of bird life on the river Axe, like Curlews, Herons, ducks and swans. You can see all the marshes from the tramway, the Parish Church of Seaton and all the rough grazing fields of the marshes.
